textBeforeTable: For full specifications see the Lenovo IdeaPad V570 specifications page. Specifications If you would like to edit this page please first view our Editing Guidelines. Editing This Page This page is just for discussing using Linux on the Lenovo IdeaPad V570. For a general discussion about this laptop you can visit the Lenovo IdeaPad V570 page on LapWik. This is a template for a future compatibility guide to running Linux with the Lenovo IdeaPad V570 laptop. If you have the Lenovo IdeaPad V570 and are running Linux on it please consider editing this page or adding a comment below with your compatibility details. By contributing you will help other people running this laptop or trying to make a decision on whether to buy it or not. Introduction Lenovo IdeaPad V570 0% (0) Unusable 11% (1)   Poor 0% (0) Fair

Discussion Ayaskull, 2013/12/22 02:18 Fedora 20 is the only distro I found that can be installed on this machine and it can boot without any post-configuration (at least with my current bios configuration I think). Just make sure to create a partition mounted in /boot/efi. It has some issues with the screen brightness configuration but everything else
